title: NFL set to land in Spain with eyes on the stunning game at real Madrid home stadium
body_text:
When and where is the NFL going to play in Spain? What we know so far
The Spanish capital has been rumoured to be preparing to host an NFL game in the coming year.
Rumours are circulating that Madrid is being targeted by NFL as a potential venue for a game, set to take place in 2024.
The Spanish capital is rumoured to be a destination for NFLâ€™s European expansion, a project which sees various games take place across the continent, away from their US homes. Three games in London and two in Frankfurt are already scheduled for 2023, meaning that Madrid would be the next European city with the honour of hosting the event.

When will the NFL game in Madrid take place?
We have little to no information at this time when the game would take place, apart from it being in 2024. NFLâ€™s European schedule is quite full for the rest of the year, meaning that the event would almost certainly be in 2024, and not before the end of the current year.

Added to that, both Real Madrid and AtlÃ©tico Madridâ€™s schedules are incredibly crammed from now until the end of the season, meaning that any action that is not soccer would find it incredibly difficult to squeeze itself onto the 2023 page of the calendar.
Where else could NFL play games outside of the USA?
Another potential venue for NFL to move to is Mexico. The same report as the one that broke the news of the potential agreement with Madrid also hinted at the fact that NFL are looking towards Mexico and more specifically, the Estadio Azteca in Ciudad de Mexico. However, given the huge building works project that the stadium is currently undergoing ahead of the World Cup 2026, something which has been scaled back due to local disputes, the idea is being put on hold for the time being.
